header.title: epp

description.p: The Erlang code preprocessor includes functions which are used by compile to preprocess macros and include files before the actual parsing takes place.

type.v: Epp = pid() -- handle to the epp server

func.name: close(Epp) -> ok
func.fsummary: Close the preprocessing of the file associated with Epp

type.v: Epp = pid() -- handle to the epp server

desc.p: Closes the preprocessing of a file.

func.name: parse_erl_form(Epp) -> {ok, AbsForm} | {eof, Line} | {error, ErrorInfo}
func.fsummary: Return the next Erlang form from the opened Erlang source file

desc.p: Returns the next Erlang form from the opened Erlang source file. The tuple {eof, Line} is returned at end-of-file. The first form corresponds to an implicit attribute -file(File,1)., where File is the name of the file.

func.name: parse_file(FileName,IncludePath,PredefMacro) -> {ok,[Form]} | {error,OpenError}
func.fsummary: Preprocesse and parse an Erlang source file

type.v: Form = term() -- same as returned by erl_parse:parse_form

desc.p: Preprocesses and parses an Erlang source file. Note that the tuple {eof, Line} returned at end-of-file is included as a "form".
